page.title: 06Farming(3)
page.content: Ryeford Farm is at the western edge of our area.It has been a farm for about one hundred and fifty years.It is one hundred acres in size and was very run down when the present owners came to it three years ago.There are no animals at Ryeford,it is an arable farm.They grow winter wheat,winter barley,main crop potatoes and rye grass.It used to be a forest before it was a farm. At the eastern edge of the region the land rises to Linton Ridge and the fields become smaller.There are a lot of small farms along the ridge and around the village of Aston Crews.These are mainly stock and dairy farms keeping sheep,cows and pigs.
